bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Joseph A. LePrince, May 13, 1920

div1.p: Carter writes that he is considering retiring. Carter believes he is facing a wide-spread yellow fever epidemic in Peru.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Joseph A. LePrince, May 13, 1920
div1.opener:
/LC
Y. F
Davies
May 13, 1920.
Senior Sanitary Engineer J. A. LePrince, U. S. P. H. S.
Room 17. Court House Building,
Memphis, Tenn.
Dear LePrince:
div1.p:
Davies--one of your old inspectors who has been working with
the oil people in Colombia and with the Baltimore mosquito cam-
paign--will possibly apply for service in Peru in Stegomyia and
Anopheles work. I know him, but do not know his qualifications.
What kind of a man is he in 1/ Stegomyia : 2 / Anopheles?

I came back a little under the weather. Am purposing to take
my retirement examination within a week and, if well enough, to
return to Peru until--say--the end of the year.

I will be in charge of an ugly, rather wide-spread, yellow
fever epidemic in northern Peru involving about 12 towns varying
from 2,000 to 40,000. An extremely troublesome proposition.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, Assistant Surgeon General.
